Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is light-brown in section and contains a number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and very faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as wine of year 17.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393412) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393412)
